body.name: Needed. Iron for Prenatal, Pregnancy, Breastfeeding, Postpartum | Thyroid Function, Immune Support, Energy, Birth Weight, Baby's Neural Development | 60ct

features: MAMAS NEED IRON: to support blood volume expansion, thyroid and immune function, fighting fatigue, and for adequate birth weight and baby’s on-time neurodevelopment.
EASY-TO-TAKE, NAUSEA-FREE: bound to Glycine for better absorption and digestive comfort.

TAILOR YOUR DAILY DOSAGE TO MEET YOUR UNIQUE NEEDS: 13.5mg per capsule, so you can easily tailor your daily dosage to meet your needs. Talk to your health practitioner about testing your Iron status before, during, and after pregnancy.

WHY IRON IS BEST TAKEN SOLO: Iron can interact negatively with other nutrients, and you should only take as much as you need. Take one capsule up to four times daily, as advised by your health practitioner. Best taken on an empty stomach.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've had low iron my whole pregnancy, I was taking the "slow fe" iron supplement tablets and my levels just were not coming up, my OB was going to have me do an infusion. I decided to give these a try and they had my levels up within about 2 weeks and I avoided needing the infusion! I take 2 each morning along with my prenatals. They are gentle on my tummy, and I finally feel like my energy and alertness is back. Definitely worth the money!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I became anemic during my pregnancy, like so many women do. My doctor told me I needed to take iron pills to ensure a healthy pregnancy. I tried liquid iron(ew) and a couple OTC iron pills. All of the other pills made my pregnancy constipation even worse and I was miserable. I gave these a try and not only have I NOT been constipated, but I've felt some of my energy return. They are easy on my stomach, you don't notice any bad flavors, and they are easy to take. Highly reccomend these (with doctor approval)!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Work really well!
reviews.reviewText: My wife finds them be more effective than other iron gummies/pills and are easy on the stomach!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Gentle iron pill
reviews.reviewText: This was nice and gentle on my stomach, however I needed to double my daily dose of iron due to prenatal anemia and taking 4 pills a day would be a bit much for me, the bottle wouldn’t last very long if I did that. If I need iron in the future at a lower dose, I would definitely purchase this brand again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this prenatal iron!
reviews.reviewText: The iron is great! I love the form because I have read it’s more easily absorbed and causes less GI issues. I haven’t had any issues so I’m stoked! I love that it’s dosed in 13.5 mg capsules so I can dose low or add more. I’m excited to have the option to slowly dose up as my pregnancy progresses! I also love the company and love supporting female-owned businesses! Would highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Will totally buy again amazing prenatal product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Open seal! Tamper concerns.
reviews.reviewText: When I received the medication the cap was ajar but still had a plastic band around it. When I opened the cap, the seal had been broken as if it had been tampered with. The item is not eligible for returns so not worth it since I won’t be using these!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good, absorbable iron; pills way underfilled..
reviews.reviewText: I just received these yesterday so I cant give a full review of the product yet. My hemoglobin levels came back under 12 and the suggested dose is 4 capsules, however I started with 2 this morning and I am glad I took it slow, because they made me feel very activated and hyper, almost uncomfortably so, but I will give it time to settle in my system. I know some times getting a deficiency back up can be uncomfortableHowever, about half of the capsules are way under filled, only about 3/4 of the way..at first I thought maybe that was how they're supposed to be but they all range in how full they are.. some are all the way full, some 3/4, some only a little under filled. The inconsistency is a little worrisome
